name: Skeleton Words 12 Quiz | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.text: PCH (A North American Indian tribe)
SRL (A republic in south-west Asia)
FTG (Physical or mental exhaustion due to exertion)
GNN (Original, real or authentic)
BQT (A large carefully arranged bunch of flowers)
RVR (The Mediterranean coastal region between Cannes, France and La Spezia, Italy)
questions.explanation:
Riviera.

	This extends 230 miles and its spectacular scenery and mild climate makes it a leading tourist centre.

questions.text: PHRH (The title of an ancient Egyptian king)
questions.explanation:
Pharaoh.

	The pharaoh was considered divine and an incarnation of the falcon-headed god Horus.

questions.text: BKPR (An apiarist)
LNLM (A floor covering)
questions.explanation:
Linoleum.

	This is a sheet material made of hessian or jute and coated under pressure and heat with a mixture of powdered cork , linseed oil, rosin and pigment. It is derived from Latin 'linum' flax and 'oleum' oil.

questions.text: MRNG (Stiffly beaten egg whites mixed with sugar and baked, often as a topping for pies and cakes)
GLR (Of more unpleasant or unsightly appearance)
NC (A unit of weight)
SHTR (Principal goddess of the Babylonians and Assyrians)
WKK (A famous resort area in Hawaii on Oahu)
questions.explanation:
Waikiki & Wai-ki-ki.

	A suburb of Honolulu. 'Xaosdog' suggested the alternative spelling of Wai-ki-ki.

questions.text: GRGYL (Grotesque animal forming waterspout)
RKRY (Collective noun for a group of penguins, rooks or seals)
MLSTRM (A strong tidal current in a restricted channel off the north-west coast of Norway)
LSN (Communication and contact between groups or units)
RYDC (In Greek mythology, nymph married to Orpheus)
GT (Agile, long-legged rodent of Central and South America)
NCTTS (Horse which belonged to the mad Roman Emperor Caligula)
questions.explanation:
Incitatus.

	Caligula became emperor after the death of Tiberius.

questions.text: GRPPN (The mother of Caligula)
BQT (A collective name for a group of pheasants)
XN (In Greek mythology the king who was punished by Zeus for his love of Hera by being bound to a perpetually revolving wheel)
BD (A song or poem appropriate to, or greeting the dawn)
questions.explanation:
Aubade.

	Hope you enjoyed the quiz and your spelling didn't let you down.
